article:
A 'polynucleotide' molecule is a biopolymer composed of 13 or more
nucleotide monomers covalently bonded in a chain. DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid)
and RNA (ribonucleic acid) are examples of polynucleotides with distinct
biological function. The prefix poly comes from the ancient Greek ÏÎ¿Î»ÏÏ (polys,
many). DNA consists of two chains of polynucleotides, with each chain in the
form of a helical spiral.
